intro: Octoknema belingensis, commonly known as the Bornean octoknema, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It thrives in tropical rainforests and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
